intro: Leipoldtia herrei, commonly known as the Cape daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with a central disk surrounded by ray florets. Leipoldtia herrei is often used in garden landscaping due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
